intro: Eclipta longifolia, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Eclipta longifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist environments.
